member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Common.DataTypesUtilities.GetVlqLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets length of variable-length quantity (VLQ) representation of an integer number.
member.param: Number to calculate VLQ length for.
member.returns: Bytes count required to represent the number in VLQ.
member.remarks: Numbers in VLQ format are represented 7 bits per byte, most significant bits first. All bytes except the last have bit 7 set, and the last byte has bit 7 clear. If the number is between 0 and 127, it is thus represented exactly as one byte.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Common.FourBitNumber
member.summary: Type that is used to represent a four-bit number (0-15).
member.remarks: Four-bit numbers widely used by MIDI protocol as parameters of MIDI events. So instead of manipulating built-in C# numeric types (like byte or int) and checking for out-of-range errors all validation of numbers in the [0; 15] range happens on data type level via casting C# integer values to the .

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.MusicTheory.NoteUtilities.GetNoteName(Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Common.SevenBitNumber)
member.summary: Gets name of the note presented by note number.
member.param: Note number to get note name of.
member.returns: Name of the note presented by .

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.MusicTheory.NoteUtilities.GetNoteOctave(Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Common.SevenBitNumber)
member.summary: Gets octave number of the note presented by note number in scientific pitch notation.
member.param: Note number to get octave of.
member.returns: Octave of the note presented by .
member.remarks: Octave number will be returned in scientific pitch notation which means that 4 will be returned for 60 note number.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.MusicTheory.NoteUtilities.GetNoteNumber(Melanchall.DryWetMidi.MusicTheory.NoteName,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the note number for the specified note name and octave.
member.param: Name of the note.
Number of the octave in scientific pitch notation.
member.returns: Number of the note represented by specified name and octave.
member.remarks: Octave number is specified in scientific pitch notation which means that 4 must be passed to to get the number of the middle C.
member.exception: Note number is out of range for the specified note name and octave.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.MusicTheory.Scale.TryParse(System.String,Melanchall.DryWetMidi.MusicTheory.Scale@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a musical scale to its equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
member.param: A string containing a scale to convert.

When this method returns, contains the equivalent of the musical scale contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or null if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the is null or , or is not of the correct format. This parameter is passed uninitialized; any value originally supplied in result will be overwritten.
member.returns: true if was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.MusicTheory.Scale.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a musical scale to its equivalent.
member.param: A string containing a scale to convert.
member.returns: A equivalent to the musical scale contained in .
member.exception: is null or contains white-spaces only.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.Interaction.TempoMapManager
member.summary: Provides a way to manage tempo map of a MIDI file.
member.remarks: This manager is wrapper for the that provides easy manipulation of specific MIDI events: and . Also it provides that can be used to calculate custom representations of time and length of an object. To start manage tempo map you need to get an instance of the . To finish managing you need to call the or method. Since the manager implements it is recommended to manage tempo map within using block.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.MidiChunk
member.summary: Represents a chunk of Standard MIDI file.
member.remarks: MIDI Files are made up of chunks. Each chunk has a 4-character ASCII string ID and a 32-bit length, which is the number of bytes in the chunk. This structure allows future chunk types to be designed which may be easily be ignored if encountered by a program written before the chunk type is introduced. The length of the chunk refers to the number of bytes of data which follow (the eight bytes of ID and length are not included).Therefore, a chunk with a length of 6 would actually occupy 14 bytes in the file.

member.param: The type of the chunk.
member.exception: is empty, or consists only of white-space characters; or length of doesn't equal 4.

member.exception: Method was called after was disposed.

Actual chunk's size differs from the one declared in its header.
Size of the chunk cannot be read since the reader's underlying stream doesn't have enough bytes.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.HeaderChunk.FileFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets format of a file where current instance of the is written or will be written.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.HeaderChunk.TimeDivision
member.summary: Gets or sets time division used in a file where current instance of the is written or will be written.
member.remarks: Time division specifies the meaning of the delta-times of events. There are two types of the time division: ticks per quarter note and SMPTE. Time division of the first type has bit 15 set to 0. In this case bits 14 thru 0 represent the number of ticks which make up a quarter-note. Division of the second type has bit 15 set to 1. In this case bits 14 thru 8 contain one of the four values: -24, -25, -29, or -30, corresponding to the four standard SMPTE and MIDI Time Code formats (-29 corresponds to 30 drop frame), and represents the number of frames per second. Bits 7 thru 0 (which represent a byte stored positive) is the resolution within a frame: typical values may be 4 (MIDI Time Code resolution), 8, 10, 80 (bit resolution), or 100.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.HeaderChunk.TracksNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of track chunks that are stored or will be stored in a file follow the header chunk.
member.remarks: Number of tracks should be 1 for a file stored in format.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.MidiEvent.DeltaTime
member.summary: Gets or sets delta-time of the event.
member.remarks: Delta-time represents the amount of time before the following event. If the first event in a track occurs at the very beginning of a track, or if two events occur simultaneously, a delta-time of zero is used. Delta-time is in some fraction of a beat (or a second, for recording a track with SMPTE times), as specified by the file's time division.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.EscapeSysExEvent
member.summary: Reprsents an "escape" system exclusive event which defines an escape sequence.
member.remarks: "Escape" system exclisive events start with 0xF7 byte and don't have a terminal 0xF7 byte that is required for normal sysex events. When an "escape" sysex event is encountered whilst reading a MIDI file, its interpretation (SysEx packet or escape sequence) is determined as follows: - When an event with 0xF0 status but lacking a terminal 0xF7 is encountered, then this is the first of a Casio-style multi-packet message, and a flag (boolean variable) should be set to indicate this. - If an event with 0xF7 status is encountered whilst this flag is set, then this is a continuation event (a system exclusive packet, one of many). If this event has a terminal 0xF7, then it is the last packet and flag should be cleared. - If an event with 0xF7 status is encountered whilst flag is clear, then this event is an escape sequence.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.EscapeSysExEvent.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the with the specified data.
member.param: Data of the "escape" sysex event.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.EscapeSysExEvent.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current object.
member.returns: A string that represents the current object.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.NormalSysExEvent
member.summary: Represents a normal system exclusive event.
member.remarks: A MIDI event that carries the MIDI system exclusive message, also known as a "MIDI sysex message", carries information that is specific to the manufacturer of the MIDI device receiving the message. The action that this message prompts for can be anything. Note that although the terminal 0xF7 is redundant (strictly speaking, due to the use of a length parameter) it must be included. System exclisive events can be splitted into multiple packets. In this case the first packet uses the 0xF0 status (such event will be read as ), whereas the second and subsequent packets use the 0xF7 status (suzh events will be read as ). This use of the 0xF7 status is referred to as a continuation event.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.TimeDivision
member.summary: MIDI file time division.
member.remarks: Time division specifies the meaning of the delta-times of events. There are two types of the time division: ticks per quarter note and SMPTE. Time division of the first type has bit 15 set to 0. In this case bits 14 thru 0 represent the number of ticks which make up a quarter-note. Division of the second type has bit 15 set to 1. In this case bits 14 thru 8 contain one of the four values: -24, -25, -29, or -30, corresponding to the four standard SMPTE and MIDI Time Code formats (-29 corresponds to 30 drop frame), and represents the number of frames per second. Bits 7 thru 0 (which represent a byte stored positive) is the resolution within a frame: typical values may be 4 (MIDI Time Code resolution), 8, 10, 80 (bit resolution), or 100.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.CompressionPolicy
member.summary: Specifies how writing engine should compress MIDI data. The default is .

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.CompressionPolicy.NoCompression
member.summary: Don't use any compression on the MIDI data to write.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.CompressionPolicy.Default
member.summary: Use default compression on the MIDI data to write. This option turns on all options that don't lead to data losing (for example, unknown meta events).

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.CompressionPolicy.UseRunningStatus
member.summary: Use 'running status' to turn off writing of the status bytes of consecutive events of the same type.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.CompressionPolicy.NoteOffAsSilentNoteOn
member.summary: Turn Note Off events into the Note On ones with zero velocity. Note that it helps to compress MIDI data in the case of is used only.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.CompressionPolicy.DeleteDefaultTimeSignature
member.summary: Don't write default Time Signature event.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.CompressionPolicy.DeleteDefaultKeySignature
member.summary: Don't write default Key Signature event.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.CompressionPolicy.DeleteDefaultSetTempo
member.summary: Don't write default Set Tempo event.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.CompressionPolicy.DeleteUnknownMetaEvents
member.summary: Don't write instances of the .

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.CompressionPolicy.DeleteUnknownChunks
member.summary: Don't write instances of the .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.MidiFileCsvConversionSettings.CsvLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets layout of CSV representation of . The default value is .
member.remarks: At now there are two layouts: and which produces slightly different CSV representations. The default value is that gives more compact and more human readable CSV data.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.MidiFileCsvConversionSettings.TimeType
member.summary: Gets or sets format of timestamps inside CSV representation. The default value is
member.remarks: Note that it is recommended to use if you use CSV layout to ensure produced CSV data can be read by other readers that supports format used by midicsv (http://www.fourmilab.ch/webtools/midicsv/) program.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.MidiFileCsvConversionSettings.CsvDelimiter

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.MidiFileSplitter.SplitByChannel(Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.MidiFile)
member.summary: Splits by channel.
member.remarks: Channel events will be separated by channel and copied to corresponding new files. All meta and system exclusive events will be copied to all the new files. Non-track chunks will not be copied to any of the new files.
member.param: to split.
member.returns: Collection of where each file contains events for single channel.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.MidiFileSplitter.SplitByNotes(Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Smf.MidiFile)
member.summary: Splits by notes.
member.remarks: Note events will be separated by note number and copied to corresponding new files. All other channel events, meta and system exclusive events will be copied to all the new files. Non-track chunks will not be copied to any of the new files.
member.param: to split.
member.returns: Collection of where each file contains events for single note number.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SliceMidiFileSettings
member.summary: Settings according to which a should be splitted.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SliceMidiFileSettings.SplitNotes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether notes should be splitted in points of grid intersection or not. The default value is true.
member.remarks: False means notes treated as just Note On / Note Off events rather than note objects for true. Splitting notes produces new Note On / Note Off events at points of grid intersecting notes.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SliceMidiFileSettings.PreserveTimes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether original times of events should be saved or not. The default value is false.
member.remarks: If false used, events will be moved to the start of a new file. If true used, events will be placed in new files at the same times as in the input file.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SliceMidiFileSettings.PreserveTrackChunks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether track chunks in new files should correspond to those in the input file or not, so empty track chunks can be presented in new files. The default value is false.
member.remarks: If false used, track chunks without events will be removed from the result.

member.summary: Gets the distance an object is going to be moved toward the new time.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of distance calculation used to find a time to snap an object to. The default value is .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingSettings.QuantizingLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of quantizing from 0.0 (no quantizing) to 1.0 (full quantizng).
member.remarks: This setting specifies how close an object should be moved to nearest grid time. For example, 0.5 will lead to an object will be moved half the distance between its time and the nearest grid time.

member.summary: Settings according to which lengthed objects should be quantized.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.LengthedObjectsQuantizingSettings.LengthType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of an object's length that should be kept in case the opposite side is not fixed. The default value is .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.LengthedObjectsQuantizingSettings.QuantizingTarget
member.summary: Gets or sets the side of an object that should be quantized. The default value is .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.LengthedObjectsQuantizingSettings.QuantizingBeyondZeroPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets policy according to which a quantizer should act in case of an object is going to be moved beyond zero. The default value is .
member.remarks: When the start time of an object is not fixed, there is a chance that the object's end time will be quantized in a such way that the start time will be negative due to the object is moved to the left. Negative time is invalid so this policy provides options to prevent this situation.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.LengthedObjectsQuantizingSettings.QuantizingBeyondFixedEndPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets policy according to which a quantizer should act in case of object's side is going to be moved beyond an opposite one that is fixed. The default value is .
member.remarks: When one end of an object is fixed, there is a chance that the object's opposite end will be quantized in a such way that the object will be reversed resulting to negative length. This policy provides options to prevent this situation.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.LengthedObjectsQuantizingSettings.FixOppositeEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an opposite side of an object should be fixed or not. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When an object's side is fixed the length can be changed during quantizing.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondFixedEndPolicy
member.summary: Policy which defines how a quantizer should act in case of object's side is going to be moved beyond an opposite one that is fixed. The default value is .

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondFixedEndPolicy.CollapseAndFix
member.summary: Object will be collapsed and fixed at fixed end's time.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondFixedEndPolicy.CollapseAndMove
member.summary: Object will be collapsed and moved to the new time calculated by a quantizer.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondFixedEndPolicy.SwapEnds
member.summary: Ends of an object will be swapped.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondFixedEndPolicy.Skip
member.summary: Object will be skipped so quantizing will not be applied to it.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondFixedEndPolicy.Abort
member.summary: Throw an exception aborting quantizing.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondZeroPolicy
member.summary: Policy which defines how a quantizer should act in case of an object is going to be moved beyond zero. The default value is .

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondZeroPolicy.FixAtZero
member.summary: Object will be shrinked due to end time quantizing and fixed at zero.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondZeroPolicy.Skip
member.summary: Object will be skipped so quantizing will not be applied to it.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondZeroPolicy.Abort
member.summary: Throw an exception aborting quantizing.
